page.title: 15Local History and Houses - 1
page.content: Eastnor Castle was built in 1812 in the style of a Medieval Castle. It is surrounded by extensive parkland which include an 18 acre lake fed by two streams and well stocked with carp. The overflow from the lake is the Glynch Brook which flows past Clencher's Mill and Pepper Mill. There is evidence that at these mills there used to be water wheels. Bromesberrow Place is a large country house constructed of timber and mortar. The large garden has a ha-ha at the end of the extensive lawns. Dingwood Park takes its name from a meeting place in the wood. It was built as a hunting lodge for the Bishops of Hereford and has their crest above the entrance. The house has several unusual features including corner fireplaces and decorative ceilings.
